aspect: 1. MLS side Orlando City are interested in signing Javier Hernandez.
2. Orlando City have a huge Latin-American fanbase and already have Kaka as their captain.
3. Eight European sides are also interested in signing Hernandez.
4. Southampton, Stoke, West Ham and Everton are interested in signing Hernandez.
5. United are willing to sell Hernandez for around £8million.
6. Wolfsburg, AC Milan, Lazio and Inter Milan are also interested in signing Hernandez.
7. United have made a revised contract offer to Andreas Pereira.
8. Paris St Germain, Juventus, PSV Eindhoven and Feyenoord have all made contact with Andreas Pereira's father.
9. Pereira rejected United's opening contract offer.
10. Pereira was on the bench against Aston Villa on Saturday.
explain: The core idea of this aspect is that Orlando City, a Major League Soccer (MLS) team, are interested in signing Javier Hernandez.

Orlando City have a huge Latin-American fanbase and already have Kaka as their captain. This means that by signing Javier Hernandez, the club would be able to attract more fans from the Latin-American community, as they would be excited to see a player from their home country playing for their team. Furthermore, having Kaka as their captain would also add to the appeal, as he is a well-known and respected player in the Latin-American community.

A core idea of the aspect "Eight European sides are also interested in signing Hernandez" is that, besides Orlando City, Hernandez has also caught the attention of other top European clubs, including eight, as the text states. The aspect highlights his potential and value on the market, showing that he is in demand among many elite teams.

The aspect states that four Premier League teams - Southampton, Stoke, West Ham and Everton - are interested in signing Javier Hernandez from Manchester United during the January transfer window. This indicates that there is a high demand for Hernandez's services from these teams, which could potentially lead to a transfer.

According to the aspect, United are willing to sell Chicharito Hernandez for around £8million. This means that despite his struggles at Real Madrid, United value him at a significant amount and see his sale as a viable option to help balance their finances, squad needs, and potential replacement.

Hernandez has been having a rough time on loan at Real Madrid this season, but he has also caught the attention of other European clubs, including Wolfsburg, AC Milan, Lazio, Inter Milan, and Orlando City, who made enquiries about the possibility of signing him.

In summary, the aspect suggests that Manchester United has made a revised contract offer to one of their players, Andreas Pereira. This means that the club is likely committed to retaining the player despite the recent struggles of Javier Hernandez at Real Madrid. United may see value in the 19-year-old Pereira, who could potentially contribute to their future success.
Given aspect reveals that several top European clubs including PSG, Juventus, PSV Eindhoven, and Feyenoord have contacted the agent of Andreas Pereira to express interest in signing him.

According to the given aspect, 19-year-old Andreas Pereira rejected United's opening contract offer. This means that the player was not satisfied with the terms and conditions of the offer and he wants better terms and conditions to continue playing for the club.

Andreas Pereira, a 19-year-old player for Manchester United, was on the bench for their match against Aston Villa on October 27th. This can indicate that Manchester United has high hopes for him and may be considering using him in future games. They may also be preparing him for increased playing time in the upcoming weeks or months.
